Samuel Hammond üåêüèõ on Twitter

item.title: Imminent Death of the Academy Predicted
item.description:
Back when I was a sophomore at Williams, the sticker price broke twenty thousand dollars for the first time, and some angry person spray-painted the columns of Chapin Hall with the digits: $20,760. I remember a lot of agitated thinkpieces about the unsustainable trajectory of higher education in the US, and predicting that some sort of reckoning would n‚Ä¶

URL: https://chadorzel.substack.com/p/imminent-death-of-the-academy-predicted?utm_source=substack&utm_campaign=post_embed&utm_medium=web

source: A Monologue: What I Have Learned About Education from the Plague Years, &

item.title: TGIF: Conspiracy Theories and Hard Realities
item.description:
‚Üí Three shootings in one week: On Saturday, in Buffalo, New York, a young white man traveled to a black neighborhood to shoot up a grocery store, killing 10 people and wounding 3. On Sunday, in Laguna Woods, California, a Chinese man went to a Taiwanese church with a gun, killing one and critically injuring four. In Dallas, a young black man went to a Korean spa, shooting three‚Ä¶

URL: https://bariweiss.substack.com/p/tgif-conspiracy-theories-and-hard?utm_source=substack&utm_campaign=post_embed&utm_medium=web

source: A Monologue: What I Have Learned About Education from the Plague Years, &

item.title: That '70s Show
item.description:
The number of references to the 1970s appearing in economic opinion columns is stacking up. With British inflation at a 40 year and with growth beginning to slow, that is understandable. There is, after all, a word for the toxic combination of weak growth and fast price rises and one that is most associated with the 1970s‚Ä¶

URL: https://duncanweldon.substack.com/p/that-70s-show?utm_source=substack&utm_campaign=post_embed&utm_medium=web

source: A Monologue: What I Have Learned About Education from the Plague Years, &

item.title: Seven Varieties of Stupidity
item.description:
‚ÄúThere are so many kinds of stupidity, and cleverness is one of the worst.‚Äù Thomas Mann. Many words have been expended on the nature of intelligence, while the topic of stupidity is comparatively neglected - even though it is all around us, screwing us up. That‚Äôs probably because we assume stupidity is just a lack of intelligence. I think there‚Äôs more to it than that. It comes in many different forms; what follows is by no means comprehensive‚Ä¶

URL: https://ianleslie.substack.com/p/seven-varieties-of-stupidity?utm_source=substack&utm_campaign=post_embed&utm_medium=web

source: A Semi-Fictitious Dialogue on a Better Elevator Pitch for ‚ÄúSlouching Towards Utopia'‚Äú‚Ä¶, &
